pullRequest.title: Show helpful message on dashboard page for missing stream permission
pullRequest.bodyText:
As described in #7505, opening a dashboard without permissions for the related streams results in a redirect to the "not found page".
With these changes we are showing a helpful error message which includes the stream ids the user needs permissions to.
Fixes #7505
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Refactoring (non-breaking change)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

Checklist:



 My code follows the code style of this project.
 My change requires a change to the documentation.
 I have updated the documentation accordingly.
 I have read the CONTRIBUTING document.
 I have added tests to cover my changes.

nodes.bodyText: I received an act() warning because of the update triggered by throwing the error. How do we deal with this case normally when using enzyme? There has to be a more elegant way.

I wrote the SearchExectuionErrors component in a way it can handle all types of errors. initially I've tried to add the .catch() to SearchActions.execute(executionState) but I prefer catching and informing the user about all possible errors (which are not part of a 403 / 404 request).
I've also tried to add the .catch() before the .finally(). but this results in some test failures I couldn't fix easily.

@dennisoelkers A few questions regarding these changes:
Would you add e.g. logoutIfUnauthorized  as a Builder method? And would you allow a customisation of the whole part or only the condition check? (in the context of logoutIfUnauthorized and redirectIfForbidden )
We should also check if the exception contains the missing streams.

Instead of having to pass handleForbidden/handleUnauthorized to every method, we should introduce two builder methods for these, which allows consumers to set these. Creating a new FetchBuilder would default to redirectIfForbidden respectively logoutIfUnauthorized.

I think this should be either Array<Error> or Array<mixed>. Object is not recommended for use, ever:

Object is an alias to any and will be deprecated and removed in a future version of Flow.

beforeCommit.message: Only avoid redirect when search execution error has type MissingStreamPermission

afterCommit.message: Implement unauthorized and forbidden handling as customizable builder methods for fetch provider

beforeCommit.message: Show all missing streams in field types resource

commit.message:
Add displayError action to handle global errors

- Add class for app errors
- Create separate component to display errors
- Rename ErrorBoundary to RuntineErrorBoundary
Do not redirect to not found page on unauthorized api requests and display global error instead
Rename ErrorsAction displayError to report
Include ScretchPad and ScrollToHint component in app runtime error boundary
Use styled components for RuntimeErrorPage
Unify runtime and unauthorized error page layout
Fix RuntimeErrorBoundary test
Rename AppError component to ReportedError
Add separate error boundary for routing
Rename AppError in ReportedError and use objects instad of a class
Fix linting errors
ADjust ReportedError creation and fix flow error
Only reset reported error on route change when reported error is being displayed
Fix RuntimeErrorBoundary test
Remove not needed prop in RouterErrorBoundary test
Unsubscribe from report error action when unmounting ReportedError component

Create own components directory for error handling related components

* Rename ReportedErrorDetails to ErrorPage
Imolement ErrorPage layout for PageErrorOverview
Fix linter warning
Revert not working linter fix and add missing import
Fix reported error reset on route change
Display ErrorPage title inside ErrorJumbotron

Rename ReportedError.js file in ReportedErrors.js and rename functions to create reported errors
Fix typos
Use not found background image by default for ErrorPage component
Remove not needed suppressConsole from tests and restrict scope of remaining
Remove not needed parentheses
Remove not needed async keyword
Use wait instead of waitForElement inside tests
Decrease ErrorJumbotron background opacity to improve readability
Fix linter warnings

Implement custom Exception for missing stream permissions

Prior to this change, we did not provide any information about
what streams the user is lacking permissions.

This change will implement a new exception where a set of stream
ids can be passed to, so the frontend can display them in a
orderly fashion.

Fixes #7505
Use http error code NOT_ACCEPTABLE (406)

Raise MissingStreamPermissionException for having no streams at all

Prior to this change, if a user did not have permissions to any streams
we raised a exception which would lead to an 404 error on the
frontend.

This change will raise an MissingStreamPermissionException which
will mapped to a NOT_ACCETPABLE (406) error code which will be
treated differently on the frontend side and not show a not found error.
Display error info on search pages when search execution fails
Add SearchExecutionErrors tests
Change SearchExecutionErrors structure
Catch all search data fetching errors
Add ExtendedSearchPage test for failing search execution
Add prop types for SearchExecutionErrors component
Adjust error info text
Add empty row
Add missing headers
Fix failing backend tests
Change error code from 406 to 403
Only show missing stream error info in search execution error component when error contains streams
Implement search execution error handling in SearchStore instead of using .catch inside ExtendedSearchPage
Allow customization of FetchProvider unauthorized and forbidden request hadnling
Do not redirect user to 404 page on missing streams error during search execution
Remove console.log
Change type for missing stream perission error
Add test for error handling in ExtendedSearchPage
Allow customization of FetchProvider unauthorized and forbidden request handling for all fetch methods
Change missing stream permissions error message
Fix SearchExecutionErrors test
Fix typo in ExtendedSearchPage test
Fix linting errors
Only avoid redirect when search execution error has type MissingStreamPermission
Implement unauthorized and forbidden handling as customizable builder methods for fetch provider
Remove Object type from SearchExectuionErrors
Type search execution errors as FetchErrors
Fix typo
Fix merge conflict

* Remove FetchProvider, SearchJob and ExtendedSearchPage changes
* Add StreamPermissionError to ReportedErrors
* Create page to display StreamPermissionErrors

commit.message: Report real FetchError on unauthorized requests
ADd test for SteamPermissionErrorPage
Merge branch 'master' into issue-7505-raise-custom-exception-for-missing-stream-permission
Remove error handling from SeachStore

Add missing stream check to FieldTypesResource

Prior to this change, if a user requested the fields to a stream
and he did not have the necessary stream permissions he got a
generic ForbiddenAccess error.

This change will return a MissingStremPermission error with the
missing steram ids.
Show all missing streams in field types resource
Adjust missing stream permission page description
Merge branch 'master' into issue-7505-raise-custom-exception-for-missing-stream-permission
Remove not neeeded test change
Fixing typo
Remove not needed paragraph from stream permission error details
Include missing stream ids info in text which can be copied with clipboard button

nodes.bodyText:
This part is also the base to display the error message for 404 api requests, instead of redirecting to /notfound.
E.g. for the dashboard and saved search page, we just need to adjust the ViewLoader, once we have a custom ReportedError.

While having another look, I realised we were not providing a real FetchError when creating a ReportedError.
I've decided to create a FetchError instead of using the SuperagentPromiseError, because the checks we are doing when we create a FetchError are still useful and it is easier to work with our own interface.
Not 100% sure, but I think it should be you do not have permissions _for_
Is additional always present if error is, or do we want to make it optional too?

Whenever we do not want the result of a boolean expression, we should now use ?? instead of ||. (As long as in this case we do not want to support setting the description prop to null to explicitly disable showing a description)

commit.message: Fixing typos
Add optional check for error.additional in StreamPermissionErrorPage
Add proper check when displaying default description in UnauthorizedErrorPage
Update StreamPermissionErrorPage test

nodes.bodyText: This component needs a better name, imo. Maybe something like ReportedErrorBoundary? It is not a react error boundary, nevertheless that's what it is doing: Rendering its children or an error if present. Renaming the component also removes the need to rename the ReportedError type import.

commit.message: Rename ReportedError to ReportedErrorBoundary
Check for correct missing streams in exception of test
Remove not needed ReportedErrors type for NotFoundErrors

nodes.bodyText: This constant is not used, from what I can see. I guess we will introduce it later, but let's remove it for now if it's not used yet.
